TEXT.English: [TAB]The Infernals enter into any game where the Infernal Pact technology is researched. They start with powerful units, including their hero, Hyborem.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]The Infernals get a free [LINK=BUILDING_ELDER_COUNCIL]Elder Council[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_TRAINING_YARD]Training Yard[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_OBSIDIAN_GATE]Obsidian Gate[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_FORGE]Forge[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_MAGE_GUILD]Mage Guild[\LINK] and [LINK=BUILDING_DEMONIC_CITIZENS]Demonic Citizens[\LINK] in each of their cities. Their cities also start with the [LINK=RELIGION_THE_ASHEN_VEIL]Ashen Veil[\LINK] religion and the [LINK=RELIGION_THE_ORDER]Order[\LINK] religion is automatically removed from cities they capture.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H1]Background:[\H1]What could be worse than hell? The domain of a fallen god, whispers of it are found in every religion.[PARAGRAPH:1]"The wicked shall face their eternal punishment in hell," says the Confessor.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Its fires burn hotter than any forge, and the foolish burn away like fool's gold," the Stonewarden warns.[PARAGRAPH:1]"The hottest days of summer do not compare," intones the Priests of Leaves, "and there is no rebirth for those defilers exiled there."[PARAGRAPH:1]The Cultists babble, "In the fire or in the void, your masters cannot speak to you, nor you to them; shun the realm of the fallen sun, and falter not in your labors for your lords, or you shall be so banished!"[PARAGRAPH:1]And in the rituals of the Ashen Veil lie these words: "From the fires of the pit, come our secrets, but we acknowledge we are supplicants, and offer the price you seek. We come to bargain, not command, oh Lords of the darkness and eternal fires. For this presumption, take not our souls, take those of our foes."[PARAGRAPH:1]But the truth is much worse. Hell is an attack on every aspect of the souls that dwell within it. An excruciating forge built to transform the weak and broken into physical manifestations of Agares's hate. In life a man may consider an act unthinkable, but through the slow manipulations of hell that act will become acceptable and then enjoyable. Many spend eternity in this slow grind, hating those above them and crushing those below them.[PARAGRAPH:1]Hyborem was not so easily satisfied, he thirsted for new challenges. With the covert assistance of Agares, the walls of creation were weakened imperceptibly by rituals learned by the Ashen Veil. Hell, always existing alongside the infinite plane where mortals dwelt, was given brief, tortured access. Hyborem took his servants and set out at once.[PARAGRAPH:1]They are forced to carve a city from the dirt with their own claws when this reality refuses to submit to their will. But that will is strengthened by Hyborem's demonic desires, and his underlings' abject fear of him. Hot tempered and impatient, he is nonetheless cunning and willing to watch the kingdoms of men, even to learn from them how to operate in this realm, until his goals are fulfilled and he can bring as many mortals into hell to torment for eternity.

TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Gli Infernali entrano in gioco in seguito alla scoperta della tecnologia [LINK=TECH_INFERNAL_PACT]Patto Infernale[\LINK]. Iniziano inoltre con delle potenti unità, tra cui il loro eroe, Hyborem.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Gli Infernali ottengono gratuitamente gli edifici: [LINK=BUILDING_ELDER_COUNCIL]Consiglio degli Anziani[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_TRAINING_YARD]Campo d'Addestramento[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_OBSIDIAN_GATE]Portale D'Ossidiana[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_FORGE]Fucina[\LINK], [LINK=BUILDING_MAGE_GUILD]Gilda dei Maghi[\LINK] e [LINK=BUILDING_DEMONIC_CITIZENS]Cittadini Demoniaci[\LINK] in ognuna delle loro città. Le loro città iniziano inoltre con la religione [LINK=RELIGION_THE_ASHEN_VEIL]Velo Cinereo[\LINK], e la religione [LINK=RELIGION_THE_ORDER]Ordine[\LINK] viene rimossa automaticamente dalle città che conquistano.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE][H1]Origine:[\H1]Cosa può essere peggiore dell'inferno? Il dominio di un dio caduto, i cui sussurri sono presenti in ogni religione.[PARAGRAPH:1]"I malvagi sarannò puniti in eterno all'inferno" dice il Confessore.[PARAGRAPH:1]"I suoi fuochi ardono più caldi di qualsiasi fucina, e gli stolti vengono inceneriti come fossero oro falso" ammonisce il Custode della Pietra.[PARAGRAPH:1]"I giorni più caldi dell'estate non sono paragonabili" intona il Sacerdote delle Foglie, "e non vi è rinascita per i profanatori li esiliati."[PARAGRAPH:1]I Cultisti farfugliano, "Nel fuoco o nel vuoto, i vostri maestri non possono parlare con voi, ne voi con loro; rifuggite il reame del sole caduto, e non vacillate negli incarichi per i vostri signori, o verrete banditi!"[PARAGRAPH:1]E nei rituali del Velo Cinereo sono presenti queste parole: "Dai fuochi della fossa provegono i nostri segreti, ma noi riconosciamo che siamo solo dei supplicanti, e offriamo il prezzo che richedi. Veniamo per contrattare, non comandare, oh Signori dell'oscurità e delle fiamme eterne. Per questa presunzione non prendere le nostre anime, ma bensì quelle dei nostri nemici."[PARAGRAPH:1]Eppure la verità è molto peggio. L'inferno attacca ogni aspetto delle anime ivi presenti. Una straziante fucina creata per transfomrmare i deboli e sconfitti in manifestazioni fisiche dell'odio di Agares per la vita. In vita un'uomo può ritenere un'atto impensabile, ma attraverso le lente manipolazioni dell'inferno tale atto diventerà accettabile e persino piacevole. In molti passano l'eternità in questa maniera, odiando quelli sopra di loro e schiacciando quelli sotto di loro.[PARAGRAPH:1]Hyborem però non era soddisfatto e desiderava nuove sfide. Con l'aiuto segreto di Agares le barriere della creazione furono indebolite impercettibilmente da rituali appresi dal Velo Cinereo. L'inferno, che coesisteva sempre al fianco del piano infinito dei mortali, ottenne una breve e contorta via d'accesso. Hyborem prese i suoi servitori e partì immediatamente.[PARAGRAPH:1]Loro furono costretti a creare la loro città con le loro mani quando questa realtà si rifiutò di assecondare la loro volontà. La stessa volontà che viene rafforzata dai desideri demoniaci di Hyborem e dalla paura di lui dei suoi sottoposti. Impulsivo e impaziente Hyborem è nondimeno astuto e disposto ad osservare i regni degli uomini, e persino ad imparare da loro come agire su questo piano, fino a quando i suoi obiettivi non saranno raggiunti e potrà portare quanti più mortali all'inferno per tormentarli per l'eternità.

TEXT.English: Strategy: The Infernal are the demonic forces of hell, they have come for only one reason - to bring ruin to Erebus.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The first step to the Infernals is getting to play them, use a high commerce civ like [LINK=CIVILIZATION_LANUN]Lanun[\LINK], [LINK=CIVILIZATION_KURIOTATES]Kuriotates[\LINK] or [LINK=CIVILIZATION_MALAKIM]Malakim[\LINK] to rush [LINK=TECH_INFERNAL_PACT]Infernal Pact[\LINK].[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Signing the pact allows you to choose your leader, and their Hero unit is decided by what leader you choose to form the pact with, there are many but a safe pick would be [LINK=LEADER_HYBOREM]Hyborem[\LINK] who's speciality is accelerating the planes slide into hell with [LINK=PROMOTION_UNRAVELING]unraveler[\LINK] and [LINK=UNIT_HYBOREM]Hyborem himself[\LINK] is a nearly immortal Balor able to crush nations by themself.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Infernals are at peace with the four horseman and all the other demonic barbarians. They are also a [LINK=TRAIT_FALLOW]Fallow[\LINK] Civ, this means they grow their city population through evil and neutral units dying in the world, giving you Manes. As the situation in Erebus grows more dire, you and your demonic allies will thrive in the chaos.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Infernal spread hell terrain, ruining the world for others, as barbarian demons materialize to terrorize all nations.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Infernals start the game with Iron, this gives their melee units an advantage in the early game.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]The Infernal world spell [LINK=SPELL_HYBOREMS_WHISPER]Hyborem's Whisper[\LINK], will allow you to seize control of a city that has the Ashen Veil religion.[NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Infernal Cities start with many useful buildings premade, such as the [LINK=BUILDING_OBSIDIAN_GATE]obsidian gates[\LINK] that allow units to teleport between cities or [LINK=BUILDING_DEMONIC_CITIZENS]demonic citizens[\LINK] that remove disease and unhappiness.

TEXT.English: Lo! Death has reared himself a throne[NEWLINE]In a strange city lying alone[NEWLINE]Far down within the dim West,[NEWLINE]Where the good and the bad and the worst and the best[NEWLINE]Have gone to their eternal rest.[NEWLINE]There shrines and palaces and towers[NEWLINE](Time-eaten towers that tremble not!)[NEWLINE]Resemble nothing that is ours.[NEWLINE]Around, by lifting winds forgot,[NEWLINE]Resignedly beneath the sky[NEWLINE]The melancholy waters lie.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]No rays from the holy heaven come down[NEWLINE]On the long night-time of that town;[NEWLINE]But light from out the lurid sea[NEWLINE]Streams up the turrets silently-[NEWLINE]Gleams up the pinnacles far and free-[NEWLINE]Up domes- up spires- up kingly halls-[NEWLINE]Up fanes- up Babylon-like walls-[NEWLINE]Up shadowy long-forgotten bowers[NEWLINE]Of sculptured ivy and stone flowers-[NEWLINE]Up many and many a marvelous shrine[NEWLINE]Whose wreathed friezes intertwine[NEWLINE]The viol, the violet, and the vine.[NEWLINE]Resignedly beneath the sky[NEWLINE]The melancholy waters lie.[NEWLINE]So blend the turrets and shadows there[NEWLINE]That all seem pendulous in air,[NEWLINE]While from a proud tower in the town[NEWLINE]Death looks gigantically down.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]There open fanes and gaping graves[NEWLINE]Yawn level with the luminous waves;[NEWLINE]But not the riches there that lie[NEWLINE]In each idol's diamond eye-[NEWLINE]Not the gaily-jeweled dead[NEWLINE]Tempt the waters from their bed;[NEWLINE]For no ripples curl, alas![NEWLINE]Along that wilderness of TEXT.German: Hallo!Der Tod hat sich den Thron errichtet[NEWLINE]an fremder ferner Stadt[NEWLINE]dort, im Untergang der Sonne[NEWLINE]Wo gut und böse, falsch und wahre Wesen sind[NEWLINE]in ewiger Umnachtung[NEWLINE]in ihren Schreinen und Palästen,[NEWLINE]in Türmen die den Zeiten trotzen[NEWLINE]uns zur Erinnerung, das alles ist vergänglich.[NEWLINE]Dort sind Gewässer, die der Wind vergaß[NEWLINE]die keine Wolken spiegeln[NEWLINE]es fällt kein Strahl vom Himmel her auf sie[NEWLINE]die Nacht ist endlos dort geblieben[NEWLINE]Doch Licht man sieht aus dieser See[NEWLINE]die Mauern leis erhellen[NEWLINE]Boote schimmern auf den Wassern[NEWLINE]über Kirchen und Zinnen, auf königliche Gemäuer[NEWLINE]auf Babylon und auf den Kathedralen[NEWLINE]fliehen die alte Schatten fort[NEWLINE]selbst lang vergessene Gebäude voll edler Kunst[NEWLINE]und mancher wunderbare Schrein[NEWLINE]voll Ebenholz und feinem Fries,[NEWLINE]ist neu entstanden in dem Lichte.[NEWLINE]Gleichgültig unter sich wölbendem Himmel[NEWLINE]ist diese melancholisch ruhige See.[NEWLINE]Erhelle nur die Türme und die Schatten jage fort[NEWLINE]auf das uns alles leicht erscheine[NEWLINE]es schaut doch währenddessen einer zu[NEWLINE]vom höchsten Punkt der Stadt[NEWLINE]der Tod sieht übergroß herab und[NEWLINE]schon öffnen Tempel und auch Gräber sich dem Licht[NEWLINE]Langeweile wächst mit jeder glänzend Welle[NEWLINE]der Statuen demantne Augen funkeln[NEWLINE]nicht ob des Reichtums und der Schätze,[NEWLINE]der Tod wird nicht in Gold gemessen.[NEWLINE]Erwachen soll die See aus einer Ruhe,[NEWLINE]ohne ein Wellenkräuseln ohne Flut.[NEWLINE]Wind und Regen die vielleicht in Ferne, glücklich, Boote führen[NEWLINE]auf friedlich und bekannte Weise.[NEWLINE]Wir rufen euch![NEWLINE]Hallo, habt ihr die Böe bemerkt? dal loro letto;[NEWLINE]Per nessuna increspatura, ahimè![NEWLINE]Lungo quella selva di vetro-[NEWLINE]Nulla dice che vento potrebbe essere[NEWLINE]Su qualche lontano mare più allegro-[NEWLINE]Ne indizzi su quale vento ci fosse[NEWLINE]Su mari meno orrendamente sereni.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ma guarda, uno spostamento d'aria![NEWLINE]L'onda- c'è un movimento li![NEWLINE]Come se le torri si fosserò TEXT.English: [TAB]Ethne tossed in her sleep. She was haunted with visions of wicked step-sisters, Sidney in her blue and yellow dress, Dain, and a dinner table that extended into darkness. Tomorrow she would have to decide if she was going to commit her people to a war against the Infernal that many would never return from. If she didn't the Infernals would crush the Amurites, who were already on the verge of collapse. But if she joined the war it would escalate further and even more would die.[PARAGRAPH:1]In her dream Hyborem sat at the end of the dinner table.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Your logic guides you to one decision, and your morality to another." Hyborem stated.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Yes." Ethne found herself unable to lie to the Lord of the Balors.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Morality is an illusion, a dream without reason. It is the shifting wind." There was no trace of magical persuasion in Hyborem's voice and Ethne was free to respond as she wanted.[PARAGRAPH:1]"A queen must be more than an accountant emotionlessly weighing one option against each other. Morality sets our goals, logic tells us how to achieve them."[PARAGRAPH:1]Hyborem smiled, though it was empty of emotion.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Imagine that you stand on your palace wall..."[PARAGRAPH:1]As Hyborem spoke Ethne could see the city surrounding her palace. It was a quiet autumn night and the city was lit by occasional lanterns and moonlight. Then guard bells rang out. Ethne could see men running along the street. Five ran along the palace walls seeking the security of the palace gate. Another man ran off into the city.[PARAGRAPH:1]Guards along the palace walls starting shouting warnings and a werewolf lumbered out of the shadows, chasing after the group of five men. The five men rushed through the palace gate and the men called for Ethne's order, if they should drop the gate portcullis or not.[PARAGRAPH:1]"If you close the portcullis" Hyborem's voice cut through the scene, "the five will live, but the werewolf will turn on the single man running into the city and kill him. You save five men, but you doom another. What is the morale thing to do?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"I would drop the portcullis and save the five men" Ethne answered. As she did she saw the scene play out. The werewolf turned and cut down the single man before fleeing the city.[PARAGRAPH:1]The scene changed, once again Ethne stood on the palace wall, and once again the guard bells started ringing. Five men ran along the palace wall, but there was no man running into the city. Instead a man stood beside her on the wall, watching the attack below.[PARAGRAPH:1]This time the werewolf was closer, the five men wouldn't be able to reach the palace gate in time.[PARAGRAPH:1]Hyborem's voice cut in again, "Again five men will die if you do nothing. Again you can save them by sacrificing one man. But this time you must push that man off the palace wall. If you push him he will fall in front of the werewolf, who will stop to kill him, giving the five men enough time to get into the palace. What is the morale thing to do?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"I would not push the man off the castle wall." Ethne said confused.[PARAGRAPH:1]"This is the illusion of morality" Hyborem said as the scene faded back to the room with the table between them, "In both cases you have the same options, but you make different decisions in the name of morality. If you want to stand against the Infernal do it because it will save the most lives, it will increase your power, you will gain the treasures of hell. But do not allow your throne to be ruled by the wind."[PARAGRAPH:1]Ethne awoke, it was dawn and her meeting with the Amurite diplomats was a few hours away. She didn't feel like she had gotten any sleep at all, and the day was only going to get worse.

TEXT.Italian: [TAB]Ethne si agitò nel sonno. Era perseguitata dalle visioni delle sorellastre malvagie, Sidney nel suo vetito blu e giallo, Dain, e un tavolo da pranzo che si estendeva nell'oscurità. L'indomani avrebbe dovuto decidere se impegnare la sua gente in una guerra contro gli Infernali dalla quale in molti non sarebbero tornati. Se invece rimaneva neutrale gli Infernali avrebbero schiacciato gli Amurite, che erano già sull'orlo del collasso. Ma se lei si univa alla guerra essa sarebbe peggiorata ancor di più e molti altri sarebbero morti.[PARAGRAPH:1]Nel suo incubo Hyborem sedeva alla fine del tavolo da pranzo.[PARAGRAPH:1]"La tua logica ti porta a una conclusione, e la tua moralità ad un'altra." Hyborem dichiarò.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Si." Ethne si trovò incapace di mentire al Signore dei Balor.[PARAGRAPH:1]"La moralità è un'illusione, un sogno senza ragione. È un vento in continuo cambiamento." Non vi era traccia di persuasione magica nella voce di Hyborem e Ethne era libera di rispondere come voleva.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Una regina deve essere più di un semplice ragioniere che valuta senza emozione un'opzione rispetto ad un'altra. La moralità definisce i nostri obiettivi, la logica ci dice come raggiungerli."[PARAGRAPH:1]Hyborem sorrise, sebbene fosse senza emozione.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Immagina di stare sulle mura del tuo palazzo..."[PARAGRAPH:1]Mentre Hyborem parlava Ethne poteva vedere la città che circondava il suo palazzo. Era una tranquilla notte autunnale e la città era illuminata dalle occasionali lanterne e dalla luce della luna. Poi le campane delle guardie suonarono. Ethne poteva vedere uomini correre per le strade. In cinque corserò lungo le mura del palazzo cercando rifugio nel cancello del palazzo. Un'altro invece corse verso il centro della città.[PARAGRAPH:1]Le guardie lungo le mura del palazzo iniziaro ad urlare avvertimenti e un lupo mannaro usci dalle ombre, inseguendo il gruppo di cinque uomini. Essi passarono di corsa nel cancello e le guardie chieserò ordini ad Ethne, se abbassare la grata del cancello o no.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Se abbassi la grata" la voce di Hyborem si inserì nella scena, "i cinque vivranno, ma il lupo mannaro andrà dal singolo uomo che sta andando in città e lo ucciderà. Salvi cinque persone, ma ne condanni un'altra. Qual è la cosa morale da fare?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Farei abbassare la grata e salverei i cinque uomini" Ethne rispose. Mentre lo diceva vide la scena compiersi. Il lupo mannaro si voltò e uccise l'uomo solitario prima di fuggire dalla città.[PARAGRAPH:1]La scena cambiò, di nuovo Ethne stava sulle mura del palazzo, e di nuovo le campane delle guardie suonarono. Cinque uomini stavano correndo sotto le mura del palazzo, ma nessuno stava correndo verso la città. Invece un'uomo stava al suo fianco sulle mura, osservando l'attacco sottostante.[PARAGRAPH:1]Questa volta il lupo mannaro era più vicino, i cinque uomini non sarebbero riusciti a raggiungere il cancello del palazzo in tempo.[PARAGRAPH:1]La voce di Hyborem si inserì di nuovo, "Di nuovo cinque uomini moriranno se tu non fai niente. Di nuovo puoi salvarli sacrificandone uno. Ma questa volta devi spingerlo giù dalle mura. Se lo fai lui cadrà davanti al lupo mannaro, che si fermerà per ucciderlo, fornendo ai cinque uomini abbastanza tempo per entrare nel palazzo.Qual è la cosa morale da fare?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"Non spingerei l'uomo giù dalle mura." Ethne disse confusa.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Questa è l'illusione della moralità" Hyborem disse mentre la scena tornava ad essere quella con il tavolo tra di loro, "In entrambi i casi tu hai la stessa opzione, ma prendi decisioni diverse nel nome della moralità. Se vuoi ergerti contro gli Infernali fallo perché salverà il maggior numero di vite, aumenterà la tua influenza e otterrai i tesori dell'inferno. Ma non permettere al tuo trono di essere governato dal vento."[PARAGRAPH:1]Ethne si svegliò, era mattina e il suo incontro con i diplomatici Amurite era fra qualche ora. Si sentiva come se non avesse minimamente dormito, e la giornata sarebbe solo peggiorata.

Hyborem stated.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Yes." Ethne found herself unable to lie to the Lord of the Balors.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Morality is an illusion, a dream without reason. It is the shifting wind." There was no trace of magical persuasion in Hyborem's voice and Ethne was free to respond as she wanted.[PARAGRAPH:1]"A queen must be more than an accountant emotionlessly weighing one option against each other. Morality sets our goals, logic tells us how to achieve them."[PARAGRAPH:1]Hyborem smiled, though it was empty of emotion.[PARAGRAPH:1]"Imagine that you stand on your palace wall..."[PARAGRAPH:1]As Hyborem spoke Ethne could see the city surrounding her palace. It was a quiet autumn night and the city was lit by occasional lanterns and moonlight. Then guard bells rang out. Ethne could see men running along the street. Five ran along the palace walls seeking the security of the palace gate. Another man ran off into the city.[PARAGRAPH:1]Guards along the palace walls starting shouting warnings and a werewolf lumbered out of the shadows, chasing after the group of five men. The five men rushed through the palace gate and the men called for Ethne's order, if they should drop the gate portcullis or not.[PARAGRAPH:1]"If you close the portcullis" Hyborem's voice cut through the scene, "the five will live, but the werewolf will turn on the single man running into the city and kill him. You save five men, but you doom another. What is the morale thing to do?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"I would drop the portcullis and save the five men" Ethne answered. As she did she saw the scene play out. The werewolf turned and cut down the single man before fleeing the city.[PARAGRAPH:1]The scene changed, once again Ethne stood on the palace wall, and once again the guard bells started ringing. Five men ran along the palace wall, but there was no man running into the city. Instead a man stood beside her on the wall, watching the attack below.[PARAGRAPH:1]This time the werewolf was closer, the five men wouldn't be able to reach the palace gate in time.[PARAGRAPH:1]Hyborem's voice cut in again, "Again five men will die if you do nothing. Again you can save them by sacrificing one man. But this time you must push that man off the palace wall. If you push him he will fall in front of the werewolf, who will stop to kill him, giving the five men enough time to get into the palace. What is the morale thing to do?"[PARAGRAPH:1]"I would not push the man off the castle wall." Ethne said confused.[PARAGRAPH:1]"This is the illusion of morality" Hyborem said as the scene faded back to the room with the table between them, "In both cases you have the same options, but you make different decisions in the name of morality. If you want to stand against the Infernal do it because it will save the most lives, it will increase your power, you will gain the treasures of hell. But do not allow your throne to be ruled by the wind."[PARAGRAPH:1]Ethne awoke, it was dawn and her meeting with the Amurite diplomats was a few hours away. She didn't feel like she had gotten any sleep at all, and the day was only going to get worse.

TEXT.English: Death Knights are a grotesque mockery of their living counterparts. Knights are resplendent in shinning armor, carry brilliant banners, and their chivalrous hearts show no fear on the battlefields. Death Knights leave a trail of walking dead and virulent disease, and show no pity in rending innocents limb from limb. Some say Death Knights can only be created from the spirit of a Knight who has broken his vows of fealty, but many Knights secretly fear that the Infernals have a way of dragging even the noblest spirit into hell to serve as their vassals. This fear prompts piety on a level royal decree would fail to reach, and rare is a Knight who doesn't seek out a blessing from any passing priest.

Ritter sind in glänzende Rüstungen gekleidet, tragen edle Banner, und ihre ritterlichen Herzen zeigen keine Angst auf dem Schlachtfeld. Todesritter hinterlassen eine Spur von Untoten und aggressiven Krankheiten, und zeigen keine Bedenken, Unschuldige Glied für Glied zu zertrennen. Manche sagen, dass Todesritter nur aus dem Geist eines Ritters geschaffen werden können, der seine Treueide gebrochen hat, aber viele Ritter fürchten insgeheim, dass die Höllischen einen Weg gefunden haben, selbst den edelsten Geist in die Hölle zu ziehen, damit der ihnen als Vasall dienen muss. Diese Angst schafft eine Frömmigkeit von einer Intensität, die kein königlicher Befehl je bewirken könnte und selten findet sich ein Ritter, der nicht von jedem vorbeiziehenden Priester einen Segen erbitten würde.
TEXT.Italian: I Cavalieri della Morte sono una grottesca imitazione della loro controparte vivente. I Cavalieri risplendono nelle loro armature scintillanti, trasportano brillanti stendardi, e il loro cuore cavalleresco non mostra timore sul campo di battaglia. I Cavalieri della Morte invece lasciano dietro di loro una scia di morti che camminano e malattie virulente, e non mostrano pietà nel smembrare gli innocenti. Alcuni dicono che un Cavaliere della Morte può essere creato solo dallo spirito di un Cavaliere che ha infranto i suoi giuramenti di fedeltà, ma molti Cavalieri temono segretamente che gli Infernali conoscano un modo per trascinare persino il più nobile degli spiriti all'inferno e renderlo un loro vassallo. Questo timore li spinge a compiere atti di pietà come neppure un decreto regale riuscirebbe, e raro è il Cavaliere che non chiede una benedizione a qualsiasi sacerdote di passaggio.

TEXT.English: There are parts of hell unclaimed by anyone. These unformed wastes are known as the Shallows and lamenting souls seek them out to hide from the unending torments of hell. Demons, with a few hell hounds in tow hunt them, gathering these souls and trading them to the lords of hell for various pleasures. The hounds keen nose can detect the fear or sorrow of a soul days after it has passed. The only way to avoid them is to remain calm and without emotion. A difficult task in hell, especially when the hounds baleful howls can be heard coming for you.

Dämonen, mit einigen Höllenhunden im Gespann, sammeln diese Seelen und ertauschen sich mit ihnen verschiedene Annehmlichkeiten bei den Fürsten der Hölle. Die feine Nase dieser Hunde kann die Furcht oder das Leid einer Seele noch nach Tagen wittern. Der einzige Weg ihnen zu entkommen ist ruhig und emotionslos zu bleiben - ein schwieriges Unterfangen in der Hölle, besonders wenn man das unheilvolle Gejaule der Hunde hört.

Dei demoni, con qualche Seguigio Infernale al seguito, danno la caccia a queste anime per poi venderle ai vari signori dell'inferno per vari piaceri. L'olfatto acuto dei Segugi può percepire la paura o la tristezza di un'anima anche giorni dopo che essa è passata. L'unico modo per evitarli è rimanere calmi e senza emozioni. Una cosa difficile da fare all'inferno, specialmente quando il loro ringhio viene sentito in avvicinamento.

His wife entered the bar an hour before and begged him to come home, but he hit her and she left crying.[PARAGRAPH:1]Perris Loon, fell from the rafters of a temple while trying to break in. He lay on the temple floor, back broken and blamed the carved angels looking down at for his situation.[PARAGRAPH:1]Adian Mor, a lonely man with dark impulses. He attempted to contain his desires by limiting his exposure to other people, and staying at the edges of the small village he lived in. When that wasn't enough he would capture an animal, usually a cat or stray farm dog, to satiate his desires for a while. He imagined the greatest of his perversions acted out on a wolf that also lurked at the edges of the village. When Adian captured the wolf he took it to his basement, a place of torment. The wolf broke free of its restraints and the two predators fought. The wolf was more merciful than Adian was and it killed him quickly.[PARAGRAPH:1]Twilla Margelin, successful merchant and landowner. His is the largest mausoleum in Girona. He died by choking on what he thought was the finest imported veal, and was actually just tenderized beef from the local stockyards.[PARAGRAPH:1]But the Infernals don't care for history or culture, and nothing causes a refocus from the trivialities of life to the eternal war better than the flames of hell. Now they are alike, hateful legions consumed only by the desire to inflict pain on the living.

TEXT.Italian: Spirito della Rovina

TEXT.English: All paths of depravity end at the same place, the souls rebirth as the least of demons, Manes. A state so unbearable the entire infernal army pushes themselves onward based solely on the fear of being demoted back to this squalid position. In hell manes are marked by the sins of their life, the amorphous forms of the gluttonous, splintered bones breaking through the skin of the hateful, the larval bodies of the greedy. But in Erebus Manes are granted a form that allows them to become workers, citizens of a cruel hierarchy.

TEXT.German: Alle Pfade der Verderbtheit enden an der gleichen Stelle, die Seelen werden wiedergeboren als niederste Dämonen, die Geister der Verfallenen. Ein so unerträglicher Zustand, das er die gesamte infernalische Armee allein voran treibt, in Angst, sie könnten in diese armselige Position zurückversetzt werden. In der Hölle sind die Geister der Verfallenen durch die Sünden ihres Lebens gekennzeichnet, die formlose Gestalt der gefräßigen, zersplitterten Knochen brechen durch die Haut der Abscheulichen, der mit Maden durchsetzten Leichen der Raffgierigen. Doch in Erebus wird Geistern der Verfallenen eine Gestalt gewährt, die ihnen erlaubt Arbeiter zu werden, Bürger einer grausamen Hierarchie.
TEXT.Italian: Tutte le depravazioni portano allo stesso risultato, la rinascita dell'anima nel minore dei demoni: Spiriti della Rovina. Uno stato cosi insostenibile che intere armate infernali vanno avanti solo grazie alla paura di essere declassati in tale squallido stato. All'inferno gli Spiriti della Rovina sono segnati dai peccati delle loro vite, la forma amorfa dei golosi, le ossa che si spezzano sotto la pelle di coloro consumati dall'odio e i corpi pieni di larve per gli avidi. Ma su Erebus agli Spiriti della Rovina viene data una forma che gli permette di diventare lavoratori, cittadini di una crudele gerarchia.
TEXT.Spanish: All paths of depravity end at the same place, the souls rebirth as the least of demons, Manes. A state so unbearable the entire infernal army pushes themselves onward based solely on the fear of being demoted back to this squalid position. In hell manes are marked by the sins of their life, the amorphous forms of the gluttonous, splintered bones breaking through the skin of the hateful, the larval bodies of the greedy. But in Erebus Manes are granted a form that allows them to become workers, citizens of a cruel hierarchy.

They are gifted to Infernal civilizations and can either be upgraded to other units or sacrificed to add population to the city.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]*Evil units are those with the Ashen Veil, Council of Esus or Octopus overlords religion. Or spellcasters that practice Death or Entropy magic.

TEXT.English: Sect of Flies
TEXT.German: Anhänger der Fliegen
TEXT.Italian: Sect of Flies
TEXT.Spanish: Sect of Flies

TEXT.English: Donal had been riding for days, and each day as he pushed further into the desert, the air had become more and more stifling, the sun more and more obscured by a haze. He had been told what was coming, the hunters had sent their hawk ahead and the news was never good. It was on the third day that he began to see the corpses, animal, human, in one hollow grave the bodies of a handful of dwarfs, all disembowelled, with their tongues cut out and their eye sockets empty.[NEWLINE] As each league passed, the swarms of flies grew more dense, the buzzing louder, and the sickly sweet smell stronger and thicker. Many of the men had taken to soaking rags in wine and tying it around their faces, but even the close smell of fermented grapes and spices did little to stave off the air, that had itself become a messenger from the Fields of Perdition, one that could not be met with sweat and steel.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ignoring the mortals need for armor smashing maces, the Infernals developed a method of infusing Iron with the souls of powerful mages, damned in their pursuit of power. A strike from a demon so equipped will leave a festering wound, passing though metal armor as if it weren't there. The aftermath of a battle with these twisted warriors leaves a stench on the battle field like no other, attracting flies to the wounds of agonizing warriors.

Ein Schlag von einem so ausgerüsteten Dämon hinterläßt eine schwärende Wunde, die sich durch Metallrüstung frißt, als wäre diese nicht vorhanden. Die Nachwirkungen eines Kampfes mit solch veränderten Kriegern hinterläßt einen Gestank wie bei keinem anderen, was Fliegen anzieht, um sich an den Wunden der leidenden Krieger zu laben.
TEXT.Italian: Donal aveva cavalcato per giorni, ogni giorno inoltrandosi sempre di più nel deserto con l'aria che diventava via via sempre più soffocante e il sole sempre più oscurato da una foschia. Gli era stato riferito cosa era in arrivo, i cacciatori avevano mandato avanti i loro falchi e le notizie non erano mai buone. Fù nel terzo giorno che iniziò a vedere i cadaveri, animali, umani, in una tomba aperta una manciata di nani, tutti sventrati, con le loro lingue tagliate e le cavità ocualri vuote.[NEWLINE] Ogni ora che passava lo sciame di mosche diventava sempre più denso, il ronzio più forte, e l'odore dolciastro più opprimente. Molti uomini avevano iniziato a inumidire degli stracci con il vino per metterseli sul naso, ma persino l'odore del vino e di spezie non migliorava l'aria, che era diventata un messaggero dai Campi della Perdizione, uno che non poteva essere affrontato col sudore e l'acciaio.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Ignorando il bisogno dei mortali per delle mazze per rompere le armature, gli Infernali svilupparono un metodo per infondere il ferro con le anime di potenti maghi, dannati nella loro ricerca del potere. Un colpo da un demone cosi equipaggiato lascerà una ferita infetta, oltrepassando l'armatura come se non ci fosse. In seguito ad una battaglia con questi guerrieri innaturali sul campo di battaglia rimane un tanfo unico, che attrae le mosche alle ferite dei guerrieri agonizzanti.
